add.title: Add
add.tip: Add a new member, but the max is 8.

image.title: Open a Image File
image.tip: Click to show a Dialog, and then drag a Image File in the app window to open it.

acceptFile.image: Please drag a image file into this app window to use it. (Press Escape key to exit.)

texture.title: Texture
texture.tip: Sets the texture (Image) to be used for the particles.

bufferSize.title: Buffer Size
bufferSize.tip: Sets the size of the buffer (the max allowed amount of particles in the system).

emissionRate.title: Emission Lifetime
emissionRate.tip: Sets the amount of particles emitted per second.

rate.title: rate
rate.tip: The amount of particles per second.

particleLifetime.title: Particle Lifetime
particleLifetime.tip: Sets the lifetime of the particles.

min_max.title: min, max
min_max.tip: The minimum(maximum) life of the particles (in seconds).

areaSpread.title: Area Spread
areaSpread.tip: Sets area-based spawn parameters for the particles. Newly created particles will spawn in an area around the emitter based on the parameters to this function.

distribution.title: distribution
distribution.tip: The type of distribution for new particles.

dx_dy.title: dx, dy
dx_dy.tip: The maximum spawn distance from the emitter along the x(y)-axis for uniform distribution, or the standard deviation along the x(y)-axis for normal distribution.

insertMode.title: Insert Mode
insertMode.tip: Sets the mode to use when the ParticleSystem adds new particles.

mode.title: mode
mode.tip: The mode to use when the ParticleSystem adds new particles.

offset.title: Offset
offset.tip: Set the offset position which the particle sprite is rotated around. If this function is not used, the particles rotate around their center.

x_y.title: x, y
x_y.tip: The x(y) coordinate of the rotation offset.

direction.title: Direction
direction.tip: Sets the direction the particles will be emitted in.

direction.title: direction
direction.tip: The direction of the particles (in radians).

spread.title: Spread
spread.tip: Sets the amount of spread for the system.

quads.title: Quads
quads.tip: Sets a series of Quads to use for the particle sprites. Particles will choose a Quad from the list based on the particle's current lifetime, allowing for the use of animated sprite sheets with ParticleSystems.

x_w_sw.title: x, w, sw
tip: x: The top-left position in the Image along the x-axis.
w: The width of the Quad in the Image.
sw: The reference width, the width of the Image. (Must be greater than 0.)

y_h_sy.title: y, h, sy
tip: y: The top-left position in the Image along the y-axis.
h: The height of the Quad in the Image. (Must be greater than 0.)
sh: The reference height, the height of the Image. (Must be greater than 0.)

speed.title: Speed
speed.tip: Sets the speed of the particles.

min_max.title: min, max
min_max.tip: The minimum(maximum) linear speed of the particles.

radialAcceleration.title: Radial Acceleration
radialAcceleration.tip: Set the radial acceleration (away from the emitter).

tangentialAcceleration.title: Tangential Acceleration
tangentialAcceleration.tip: Sets the tangential acceleration (acceleration perpendicular to the particle's direction).

linearDamping.title: Linear Damping
linearDamping.tip: Sets the amount of linear damping (constant deceleration) for particles.

min_max.title: min, max
min_max.tip: The minimum(maximum) amount of linear damping applied to particles.

linearAcceleration.title: Linear Acceleration
linearAcceleration.tip: Sets the linear acceleration (acceleration along the x and y axes) for particles. Every particle created will accelerate along the x and y axes between xmin,ymin and xmax,ymax.

min.title: xmin, ymin
min.tip: The minimum acceleration along the x(y) axis.

max.title: xmax, ymax
max.tip: The maximum acceleration along the x(y) axis.

spin.title: Spin
spin.tip: Sets the spin of the sprite.

variation.title: variation
variation.tip: The amount of variation (0 meaning no variation and 1 meaning full variation between start and end).

rotation.title: Rotation
rotation.tip: Sets the rotation of the image upon particle creation (in radians).

enable.title: enable
enable.tip: True to enable relative particle rotation, false to disable it.

colors.title: Colors
colors.tip: Sets a series of colors to apply to the particle sprite. The particle system will interpolate between each color evenly over the particle's lifetime.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.tip: Sets a series of sizes by which to scale a particle sprite. 1.0 is normal size. The particle system will interpolate between each size evenly over the particle's lifetime.

variation.title: variation
variation.tip: The amount of variation (0 meaning no variation and 1 meaning full variation between start and end).

position.title: Position
position.tip: The position to draw the object.

color.title: Color
color.tip: Sets the color used for drawing.

alphaMode.title: alpha Mode
alphaMode.tip: What to do with the alpha of drawn objects when blending.

operation.title: Operation
operation.tip: Operate the List and Particle Object.

open.title: Open
open.tip: Open a Particle File to create a Particle Object.

clone.title: Clone
clone.tip: Clone the selected Particle Object to create a Particle Object.

reset.title: Reset
reset.tip: Reset the selected animation of Particle Object.

pause.title: Pause
pause.tip: Pause the selected animation of Particle Object.

up.title: Up
up.tip: Move up the selected order of Particle Object in List.

down.title: Down
down.tip: Move down the selected order of Particle Object in List.

save.title: Save
save.tip: Save the selected Particle Object to a Particle File.

remove.title: Remove
remove.tip: Remove the selected Particle Object in List.

list.title: List
list.tip: Show all Particle Object, and select one Particle Object to operate.

backgroundImage.title: Background Image
backgroundImage.tip: Sets the image to be changed for the background.

liveCount.title: Live Count:
liveCount.tip: The current number of live particles.

about.title: About Particle Editor
text: This is a editor of particle for LÖVE. It be entrusted on the Coding.net. (https://git.coding.net/musoucrow/ParticleEditor.git)
It is licensed under the MIT License, see LICENSE for more information.

use.title: How to use?
text: In ParticleEditor, you can make some Particle File to give your project to use.
The Particle File's format is JSON, so you need to use the library of CJSON in your project.(Already be included in the lib folder)
You can use the specially function in the load.lua to load Particle File and then to create Particle System object.
The Particle File doesn't have Texture data, so you need to prepare yourself.
Lastly, you need to see the README.md to learn more.
